intro: Govenia tequilana, commonly known as the tequila plant, is a species native to Mexico. It is a flowering plant belonging to the Amaryllidaceae family, characterized by its striking white and green striped leaves. The plant produces clusters of fragrant, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in the spring. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sunlight, making it suitable for warm, arid climates. Due to its ornamental value and association with tequila production, it is often cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
